availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Ancell M. Holloway (Graves County, Kentucky, farmer and justice of the peace)

body.p: Graves County, Kentucky, farmer and justice of the peace. Tennessee native. Married to Melissa A. Hickason Holloway. Father of Alphous Holloway, Jennie Holloway, John E. Holloway, Martha Ann Holloway, Fleming C. Holloway, W. S. Holloway, Frances C. Holloway, and James B. Holloway. Farmer in Graves County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Graves County in 1860. Justice of the peace in Graves County in 1861. Farmer in Mississippi County, Missouri, in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Graves County, District 1, p. 438B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Graves County, p. 268-69.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Missouri, Mississippi County, Tywapitty, p. 351A.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994035, Graves County Births.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Mississippi County, MO, 1863.
KYR-0001-017-0153.
